trans-unit.source: Describes the characteristics of an argument of an activity to the runtime.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> class using a name, data type, and argument direction.
The name of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The type of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The direction of data flow through an argument.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> class using a name, data type, argument direction, and a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value.
The name of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The data type of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The direction of data flow through an argument.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value; otherwise `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> class using a name, data type, argument direction, and a list of overload group names.
The name of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The data type of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The direction of data flow through an argument.
The overload groups that apply to this <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> class with a name, data type, argument direction, whether the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value, and a list of overload group names.
Required arguments that are unbound result in validation errors that are displayed at design time.

The <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is set to `true` if the <xref:System.Activities.RequiredArgumentAttribute?displayProperty=fullName> is applied to an argument.
Overload groups can be set on arguments through the <xref:System.Activities.OverloadGroupAttribute>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The data type of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The direction of data flow through an argument.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value; otherwise `false`.
The names of the overload groups that apply to this <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
Gets the direction of the data flow through this <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The direction of data flow through an argument.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The value of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
Gets the strongly-typed value of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The return value type.
The value of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
Returns the <xref href="System.Activities.Location"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The argument location.
The location of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value.

If an argument is required and not bound to a value a <xref:System.Activities.ValidationException> is thrown when the containing activity is prepared for execution, unless overload groups are used and the required arguments of an overload group are bound.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)]<xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.OverloadGroupNames%2A>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> is required to be bound to a value; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a list of the overload groups that this <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref> belongs to.
Arguments can be grouped together to form valid overload groups.
<xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.OverloadGroupNames%2A> identifies the overload groups to which this argument belongs.
An overload group cannot be a subset or an equivalent set of another overload group.
The only exception to this rule is a subset that contains only arguments where <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A> is `false`.
Overload groups can overlap but it is an error if the intersection of the groups contains all the required arguments of one or both the overload groups.
An overload group is considered bound if all the <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A> arguments in the group are bound.
If a group has zero <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A> arguments and at least one argument bound, then the group is considered bound.
It is an error if none of the groups are bound unless one overload group has no <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A> arguments in it.
Binding <xref:System.Activities.RuntimeArgument.IsRequired%2A> arguments from more than one overload group is not permitted.
It is an error to have more than one overload group bound, that is, all required arguments in one overload group are bound and any argument in another overload group is also bound.
Any violation of the preceding rules results in a <xref:System.Activities.ValidationException> being thrown when the containing activity is prepared for execution.
[!INCLUDE[crdefault](~/includes/crdefault-md.md)] <xref:System.Activities.OverloadGroupAttribute>.
A list of overload group names.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
The current activity context.
The new value for the <xref href="System.Activities.RuntimeArgument"></xref>.
